name: kanata
description: Cross-platform software keyboard remapper for Linux, macOS and Windows

repo.name: kanata
repo.description: Improve keyboard comfort and usability with advanced customization

readme.summary: Excellent comprehensive documentation with clear explanations, multiple installation methods, and rich examples, though quick start could be more prominent and troubleshooting is somewhat scattered.
readme.top_issue: Quick start example buried after conceptual explanation - new users must scroll past 'Why is this useful?' and 'Usage' sections before seeing actual configuration examples in collapsed details sections

injection_risks.description: The use of `std::sync::mpsc::sync_channel` with a fixed buffer size could potentially lead to a deadlock if the channel is not properly drained.
The use of `std::process::exit` can make it difficult to handle errors and clean up resources properly.

critical_findings: Potential deadlock in the use of `std::sync::mpsc::sync_channel`
Use of `std::process::exit` can make error handling difficult
security.summary: The code has some potential security risks and areas for improvement, but overall it appears to be well-structured and secure.

common_complaints: Platform-specific keyboard support gaps (macOS, Windows ARM, Linux)
Device detection and HID access issues
sentiment.summary: Active project with steady feature requests and bug reports, but moderate responsiveness; users encounter platform-specific friction with keyboard support and device handling, though issues appear addressed within reasonable timeframes.

communication.summary: The maintainer provides generally helpful and clear responses, but could improve in terms of welcoming new contributors and avoiding assumptions about users' technical backgrounds.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite last commit being recent (2026-01-11)
115 open issues with no recent activity
No closed issues in past 6 months indicating no active bug fixes
Zero merged PRs in past 6 months showing no feature development
No active contributors in past 6 months
Unknown last release date suggests release tracking has ceased
positive_signals: Recent commit history exists (2026-01-11), though not maintained
maintenance.summary: The project appears abandoned with no maintenance activity for 6+ months despite recent historical commits, evidenced by 115 unresolved issues and zero development activity.

project_metrics.description: Improve keyboard comfort and usability with advanced customization

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The README provides a good overview of the package and its features, but could benefit from more concise language and better troubleshooting documentation.
concerns: Docs: Lack of clear and comprehensive troubleshooting section
Communication: occasional assumption of prior knowledge
Security: Potential deadlock in the use of `std::sync::mpsc::sync_channel`
Security: Use of `std::process::exit` can make error handling difficult
highlights: Recent commits (113 in the last 6 months)
Active issue and PR management (66 closed issues and 66 merged PRs in the last 6 months)
Multiple active contributors (19 in the last 6 months)
